title: Easily Block Websites on an iPad with Screen Time

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . It has an icon that resembles two gears. Tap the icon on your Home screen to open the Settings app.

steps.title: Tap Screen Time.
steps.content: Tap Screen Time . It's next to a purple icon that resembles an hourglass. This menu allows you to set restrictions for your or your child's iPad.

steps.title: Tap Turn On Screen Time.
steps.content: Tap Turn On Screen Time . It's the blue text at the top of the page. This displays a page explaining what Screen Time is. You need to enable Screen Time in order to set content restrictions.

steps.title: Tap Continue.
steps.content: Tap Continue . It's the blue button at the bottom of the Screen Time explanation page.

steps.title: Tap This is My iPad or This is My Child's iPad.
steps.content: Tap This is My iPad or This is My Child's iPad . If you enable Screen Time on your own iPad, it will enable the Screen Time settings menu immediately. If you enable Screen Time for a child's iPad, you will be asked to set additional Screen Time settings, such as a scheduled downtime, and app limitations. You will also be asked to provide a PIN that you can use if you need to bypass Screen Time and content restrictions.

steps.title: Tap Content & Privacy Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Content & Privacy Restrictions . It's next to a red icon that has a circle with a line through it. This menu allows you to block inappropriate content.

steps.title: Slide the toggle switch next to "Content & Privacy Restrictions" to On .
steps.content: Slide the toggle switch next to "Content & Privacy Restrictions" to On . Tap the toggle switch at the top of the page to enable Content & Privacy Restrictions. This allows you to use the Content & Privacy Restrictions menu.

steps.title: Tap Content Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Content Restrictions . It's near the top of the Content & Privacy Restrictions menu.

steps.title: Tap Web Content.
steps.content: Tap Web Content . It's about halfway down the Content Restrictions page, below a header that says "Web Content."

steps.title: Tap Limit Adult Websites or Allowed Websites Only.
steps.content: Tap Limit Adult Websites or Allowed Websites Only . Both of these options allow you to restrict websites. Limit Adult Websites: This option automatically limits access to many adult websites and allows you to create a list of additional blocked websites, as well as websites that are always allowed. Allowed Websites Only: This option blocks all websites except for those listed in the "Allowed" list of websites.

steps.title: Tap Add Websites below "Never Allow."
steps.content: Tap Add Websites below "Never Allow." It's the second list under "Limit Adult Websites." This allows you to enter a website you want to block. If you selected "Allowed Websites Only," tap Add Website at the bottom of the list of allowed websites to add a new website to the list of "Allowed" websites.

steps.title: Enter the web address for the website you want to block.
steps.content: Enter the web address for the website you want to block. Enter the full web address for the website you want to block (i.g https://www.facebook.com). Tap Done on the keyboard when you are finished. This adds the website to the "Never Allow" list. You can add as many websites as you want.
